ca.keefer.sanemethod.Interface
Class TextHandler

java.lang.Object
  ca.keefer.sanemethod.Interface.TextHandler

public class TextHandler
extends java.lang.Object

This class enables the abstraction of the inner workings of the Text objects when calling such functions from the States - rather, we provide TextHandler with an ArrayList of Text objects, and allow it to handle the mess - boiling down the calls needed from the state to ones like TextHandler.update or TextHandler.acceptInput.

Version:
1.2
Author:
Christopher Keefer

Constructor Detail

TextHandler

public TextHandler(java.util.ArrayList<Text> thisDialog)
This minimal constructor prepares all the text objects in the ArrayList with the default values of x=50, position = Text.BOTTOM, and boxWidth=750

Parameters:
thisDialog - The text object ArrayList

TextHandler

public TextHandler(java.util.ArrayList<Text> thisDialog,
                   float x,
                   float y,
                   short position,
                   int boxWidth)
This full constructor allows the specification of both the Text object arraylist, and all the parameters which will be used to initialize each object. To specify different positions, x values or boxWidths for individual Text objects, either set them before passing them to TextHandler, or use the TextHandler.getByName or getByIndex functions to get and alter the individual Text objects.

Parameters:
thisDialog - The text object ArrayList
x - float for position of text along the left margin
y - float for position of text along y axis
position - short for position of text vertically on screen (Text.BOTTOM, MIDDLE or TOP)
boxWidth - width of the text box versus the right margin
Method Detail

display

public void display(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
This is called to draw the text to the screen, as well as the text box

Parameters:
g - Graphics object for screen context

update

public void update(int delta)
Called to update the letter-by-letter display, as well as any other update requirements. Generally not required for Option Text Objects.

Parameters:
delta - int Time passed since last update call

getCurrent

public int getCurrent()
Return the index of the currently displaying dialog

Returns:
integer of the index of the currently displaying dialog

acceptInput

public void acceptInput(int keyPressed)
Lengthy function which accepts input from the state (in the form of an integer detailing which key has been pressed, and compared against the KEY Constants), and performs the necessary functions on the Text objects. This function also controls the progression of the text objects to be displayed, and the summary ending of display once the end display ('@@') characters have been reached.

Parameters:
keyPressed -

public java.lang.String getOptionSelection()
If we want the selected optionfor seom purpose external to this dialog

Returns:
a String containing the selected option value

getDone

public boolean getDone()
Get whether this textHandler is finished displaying its contents

Returns:
true if all contents have been displayed

public void reset()
Reset this textHandler so its ready to display its contents again

getByName

public Text getByName(java.lang.String name)
If the Text object with the given name (case-sensitive) exists, then find and return it.

Parameters:
name - String name of Text object as defined by the XML.
Returns:
Text Object

getByIndex

public Text getByIndex(int index)
Returns the Text object at the given index. If index is out of bounds, returns null.

Parameters:
index - int position of Text object in the ArrayList.
Returns:
Text Object
